glsa.title: Xfig: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Xfig could result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

background.p: Xfig is an interactive drawing tool.

description.p: Xfig contains a buffer overflow vulnerability in processing certain FIG images.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially-crafted file, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Xfig users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since January 09, 2011. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
